scrapery.html_api.absolute_url(element, selector=None, base_url=None, attr='href')[source]

Extract absolute URLs from elements using html_selector_content for CSS/XPath.

Parameters:

  • element (ScraperyHTMLElement) – Root element to search within.

  • selector (str, optional) – CSS or XPath selector. If None, use element itself.

  • base_url (str, optional) – Base URL for resolving relative links.

  • attr (str) – Attribute containing the URL (“href” or “src”).

Returns:

List of absolute URLs.

Return type:

list[str]

scrapery.html_api.get_embedded_json(page_source=None, ld_json_type=True, selector='[type="application/ld+json"]', find_by_tag_name='script', search_keyword=None)[source]

High-level helper: extract JSON either from LD+JSON or keyword-based script.

Return type:

Any

xml_api module functions

scrapery.xml_api.parse_xml(source, **kwargs)[source]

Parse XML from string, bytes, file path, or URL.

Parameters:

  • source (str | bytes | Path) – XML input (string, bytes, file path, or URL).

  • **kwargs – Extra options for parser.

Returns:

Parsed XML root element.

Return type:

ScraperyXMLElement

scrapery.xml_api.xml_transform(element, xslt_str)[source]

Apply XSLT transformation.

Parameters:

  • element (ScraperyXMLElement) – ScraperyXMLElement to transform.

  • xslt_str (str | bytes) – XSLT stylesheet as str or bytes.

Returns:

Transformed root element.

Return type:

ScraperyXMLElement

Raises:

ParserError – If transformation fails.

scrapery.json_api.json_content(json_obj=None, keys=None, position='first')[source]

Entry point to extract nested values using either first-match or last-key-path.

If input is a JSON string, attempts to parse it with ujson first.

Return type:

Any
